description: This document outlines the requirements for the purchase of a hazardous waste compactor to compact waste, including empty plastic and metal containers with hazardous waste residue into 200L barrels, Crushing of defective barrels and delivery of the system to Department of National Defence

full_summary:
**Tender Notice Information**
================================

*   **Tender Title**: Hazardous Waste Compactor
*   **Reference Number**: WS3670300002-Doc3676723080
*   **Publication Date**: November 15, 2022
*   **Tender Closing Date**: December 13, 2022, at 2:00 PM EST
*   **Location**: British Columbia, Canada
*   **Procurement Method**: Competitive Open Bidding
*   **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Tender Overview**
-------------------

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking proposals from qualified vendors for the provision of a hazardous waste compactor. The successful bidder will be responsible for supplying and delivering the system to the Department of National Defence (DND).

**Key Requirements**
--------------------

*   The compactor must be capable of compacting waste, including empty plastic and metal containers with hazardous waste residue, into 200L barrels.
*   The system must also be able to crush defective barrels.
*   The compactor must be in compliance with all relevant Canadian regulations and standards.

**Evaluation Criteria**
----------------------

The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

*   Price
*   Technical capabilities of the proposed solution

**Trade Agreements**
-------------------

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Contact Information**
---------------------

To obtain the solicitation package or to submit a proposal, please contact:

Reusch, Bill (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [bill.reusch@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:bill.reusch@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

Please note that all submissions must be made through the Vendor Interface of the Government of Canada’s Buy and Sell (CCN). 

[**View Solicitation Package**][1]

 Note: Hyperlinks will not change. Nonetheless, all details are pertinent to the tender announcement, but the rewriting involved creating a better organizational structure and optimizing the key information for clarity. 

The rewrite has streamlined the original text and highlighted the most important details.
